intro: Senecio gardneri, commonly known as Gardner's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Senecio gardneri is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
